com.github.fge.filesystem

Class MoreFileSystems

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.fge.filesystem.MoreFileSystems

  • @ParametersAreNonnullByDefault
public final class MoreFileSystems
extends Object
    Utility class for FileSystems

    This utility class offers methods to:

    • open zip files as file systems (therefore including jars, wars etc);
    • wrap existing file systems in a read only wrapper.

    It is the user's responsibility to close the filesystems returned by these methods.

    Unless otherwise noted, all methods in this class do not accept null arguments and will throw a NullPointerException if a null argument is passed to them.

    • Method Detail

      • openZip

        @Nonnull
@WillNotClose
public static FileSystem openZip(Path path,
                                      boolean readOnly)
                          throws IOException
        Open a zip as a file system, read write or read only

        Note that if it is determined that the zip file is not writable by the current user, the file system will be read only even if the readOnly argument is false.

        Parameters:
        path - the path to the zip
        readOnly - whether the zip should be opened read only
        Returns:
        the filesystem
        Throws:
        FileSystemNotFoundException - zip does not exist
        IOException - failed to open the path as a zip filesystem

      • createZip

        @Nonnull
@WillNotClose
public static FileSystem createZip(Path path)
                            throws IOException
        Create a new zip file as a filesystem
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the zip to create
        Returns:
        a filesystem
        Throws:
        FileAlreadyExistsException - zip file already exists
        IOException - other errors

      • readOnly

        @Nonnull
@WillNotClose
public static FileSystem readOnly(FileSystem fs)
        Return a read only version of a filesystem, if necessary

        If the filesystem given as an argument is already read only (ie, FileSystem.isReadOnly() returns true), this method will return the filesystem itself.

        Parameters:
        fs - the filesystem
        Returns:
        a read only filesystem
